column5: What a day, what a day. Was out on the Yak in Lake Gibson and landed this nice biggins. Now Im wondering, Im thinking this is a Pike but could it be a Muskie? I never caught a muskie and this just seemed alittle different, maybe Im tripping but yawl experinced Muskie Masters can tell me what sliced my thumb open........OUCH!
that would be a northern pike
Ya thats what I should have known, maybe i lost alitle more blood then a thought......
you didn't try to lip him did ya?
Is that a livewell on your yak ? if so thats cool!

I sure did my friend, wanted to get a shot with its mouth open. I know better then to be stickin my fingers in a Pikes mouth but thought i was quicker..........i thought wrong . I just bought some Berkley gloves too but of course i forgot them

That it is SRT8, it has a pumpinside and intake on the underside of the yak. i flip a switch and it pumps it in to the livewell. It also has a sliding console with rod holders and fish finder. I run a 30lb thrust trolling motor that I had custom made (Bassyaks) and assembled it just a few weeks ago, havebt used my paddle much since........ Bring it on fish.......
you should have checked  underneath the fish's head to see how many pores it had
Exactly! I just found that out, Pike have 8 and muskie have like 10 to 12 pores. Most say its a Pike, my buddy thought it was a muskie for sure, guess I'll call it a Musike.......

So you ask everyone whether it's a pike or a muskie. The folks tell you it's a pike (and it is) but you ignore the answers and call it a muskie all the same? If you had your opinion formed beforehand, why even ask?
Good point, will do next round.
Split the difference, call it a musky/pike cross, a tiger musky!!
He didn't call it a muskie Roy....he called it a Musike.... a little play on words....you might want to wear your glasses when reading..
